summary: Multiplayer Spy Word party game: players create/join rooms via code, host can start when 3–10 players joined, one player is the spy (no word), others get a hidden word, players give one-word chat clues on timed turns, then vote; majority vote determines winner; chat remains enabled during voting.
known_issues: Start button not appearing for host when expected (after 3–10 players join).

existing_features.title: Fix the lobby logic so the host is correctly detected even when the backend assigns a host playerId that is not 1 (e.g., after other rooms have already been created), ensuring the Start Game button appears for the host when appropriate.

Update the Start Game availability rules in the lobby UI to match the intended constraints: the Start Game button must be enabled only when there are 3–10 players in the room (and disabled otherwise), with accurate helper text/badges.

new_feature_requests.summary: Room creation and join-by-code flow for multiplayer sessions
Host-only Start button appears when 3–10 players have joined the room
Game start assigns one random hidden word to all non-spy players and shows 'You are the spy' to the spy
Chat-only clue phase with enforced one-word-per-player turn and 10-second timer per turn
Voting phase after all turns; majority vote decides outcome (spy caught => players win, wrong vote => spy wins) with chat enabled during voting

projectName: Fix Lobby host Start Game button visibility and start conditions
